Liverpool flop Mario Balotelli could be set for Premier League return with English clubs keen on 'bargain' striker

And Mino Raiola has claimed clubs in England and Italy — where Balotelli has played with AC Milan and Inter — are keen on adding him to their ranks.

He said: 'Mario is ready to return, he has matured into one of the top 10 strikers in the world.

'In Italy he's No 1. He's worth €100million (£88m), but he's on a free transfer and is therefore a bargain.

'I'm negotiating with many clubs in England and in Italy. I've spoken with Juventus, Roma, Napoli and Inter.'

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-5453509/Liverpool-flop-Mario-Balotelli-wants-Premier-League-return.html

Liverpool have made contact with Napoli midfielder Jorginho, Brazilian outlet UOL Esporte reports.

MBIA RELEASED FROM CHINA

Former Queens Park Rangers midfielder Stephane Mbia has left Hebei China Fortune.

The 31-year-old Cameroon international is now a free agent after reaching an agreement to leave the Chinese Super League side.

'NEVER SAY NEVER'

Mina Raiola has refused to rule out the possibility of his client Paul Pogba joining Real Madrid in the future.

The Bernabeu giants were reportedly interested in the Frenchman before he made his return to Manchester United in 2016.

Pogba’s form and role in the team at United in recent weeks has prompted suggestions he is not entirely happy at Old Trafford, but his representative Raiola says he is not at war with manager Jose Mourinho and insists the midfielder would prefer to win major trophies before leaving Old Trafford.

Discussing speculation linking Pogba to Madrid, Raiola told Rai Sport: “If things aren’t going well I try to do my job, looking for satisfactory solutions for my players and the clubs. At the moment Paul hasn’t told me anything and I know that he does not move without having won any titles. There is not the war with [Jose] Mourinho that is being talked about, but in the market the truth is never told and you can never say never.”

‘SIGN HIM UP’

Agent Mino Raiola has urged Napoli to move for Mario Balotelli when his contract expires at Nice at the end of the season.

"It's obvious that whoever takes Mario on a free transfer will be getting a bargain," Raiola told Radio Kiss Kiss Napoli.

"If I were Napoli I'd take him, he's one of the best strikers around. [Maurizio] Sarri has had an enormous growth and he'd be ideal for the Naples environment.

"Balotelli is explosive on the pitch, he's made strides forward with his behaviour. Napoli would be fantastic for a player with his characteristics and his character.”

Antonio Conte calls on Chelsea to ‘show ambition’ in transfer market

“I have great ambition, but I don’t have money to spend for Chelsea. The club knows very well what is my ambition.

“When you decide to work with this type of coach, you must understand that you take a coach with great ambition. Not a loser but a winner.”

When asked whether the club matched his ambition, he replied: “I don’t know.”

https://inews.co.uk/sport/football/antonio-conte-chelsea-show-ambition-transfer-manchester-city/

ZLATAN: MLS IS TEMPTING

Zlatan Ibrahimovic says a move to MLS is "tempting" as he heads towards a probable departure from Manchester United.

Jose Mourinho admitted on Friday this season was likely to be the Swede's last at Old Trafford, with his contract due to expire in the summer.

Speaking to Swedish reporters in Stockholm this week, Ibrahimovic, 36, said: "I did not know that several Swedes went to MLS. That means it's tempting to play in the United States.

"Los Angeles is a nice city and I've been there a lot on vacation. It is laid back."

'I want to play for them again': Ramires eyeing Chelsea return two years after leaving for Chinese Super League

Brazilian midfielder Ramires wants a return to Chelsea.

The 30-year-old star quit for Chinese Super League club Jiangsu Suning in a shock January 2016 deal.


By then he’d helped the Blues to the Champions League, the Europa League, the Premier League, the League Cup and the FA Cup with the Blues.

He opted to cash in after slipping down the pecking order at Stamford Bridge under then-boss Guus Hiddink.

But Ramires has now opened the door to a return by admitting he’d be prepared to go back.

He said: “Chelsea? I’ll always have special affection for them and I want to play for them again before finishing my career.

“I know the doors of Stamford Bridge will always be open to me and that wearing their jersey again would be spectacular.”

https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/i-want-play-again-ramires-12131756

BALOTELLI INVITES SERIE A OFFERS

Former Man City and Liverpool striker Mario Balotelli says he wants to return to Italy in the summer, and invited offers from Juventus or Napoli.

Balotelli has scored 21 goals this season for Nice, and is a free agent in the summer.

Speaking on Rai Sport, Balotelli said: "My agent Mino Raiola is taking care of my future. All I know is that I have matured and I am ready to come back to Italy.

"I think it'd be very difficult to come to Milan, as it would be the third time, but Juventus and Napoli are two teams that I like."

KEYNCKES BACKS TUCHEL

Bayern Munich coach Jupp Heynckes believes Thomas Tuchel would be an ideal choice to be his successor.

Heynckes was appointed in October on a deal until the end of the season and former Borussia Dortmund boss Tuchel is the favourite to succeed him in the summer. The 44-year-old has been out of work since leaving Dortmund last summer.

"I think that Thomas Tuchel has the quality to train Bayern," Heynckes said in an interview with Sport Bild.

He added: "Borussia Dortmund played very good football under Tuchel, with a good system. All the modern elements that are part of football today, were there."

'I'M HERE LONG TERM'

Sam Allardyce insists he is still the right man to lead Everton and says he is planning for the long-term at Goodison Park.

Allardyce faces mounting pressure at Everton with the Toffees languishing in 11th place in the Premier League, following a run of just two wins from the last 12 games in all competitions.

He said: "It's very disappointing for everybody that we've slipped to where we have slipped to after the fantastic position we put ourselves in the early stages of me walking through the door.

"I came out of retirement because there's a long-term plan at Everton that I was excited to be a part of."

Riyad Mahrez: Leicester winger says team-mates stood by him

Leicester winger Riyad Mahrez says his team-mates have stood by him since his failed move to Manchester City.

The 27-year-old missed training after the January transfer collapsed, but is back in the fold and his late equaliser rescued a point against Bournemouth in the Foxes' last game.

Mahrez admitted to "regrets" over the saga but said he now wants to put it behind him.

"It was a difficult situation. Now it's the past, it's behind," he said.

The Algeria international, who has played in Leicester's past four games, told Sky Sports he was grateful for how his team-mates reacted to his return.

"I was away from here because I needed some time to think," he said. "You'll always have regrets but at that time I thought it was the best thing to do.

"I spoke with the players, I spoke with the manager, I spoke with everyone. Everyone was OK, was good.

"I've always been in contact with the club. The club handled it very well."

http://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43331305

Rakitic on Neymar return: 'I would open the door for him to come back right now'

Barca coach Ernesto Valverde called the rumours "fantasy" on Friday but Rakitic was more welcoming to the idea of the Brazil international coming back to the club.

"Neymar's not said anything to me, but if it was up to me I would open the door for him to come back right now," Rakitic told reporters after Barca beat Malaga to move 11 points clear at the top of La Liga.

"Not just because of the relationship I have with him, but because of the type of player he is. I would always put Neymar in my team."

INTER WANT STROOTMAN

Inter Milan are trying to land Roma midfielder Kevin Strootman, according to Calciomercato.

Luciano Spalletti wants to bring in midfield reinforcements having failed to properly do so during the winter window and the Netherlands midfielder is on their list of summer targets.

The 28-year-old has a €45m release clause but Inter don't intend to pay that and want to negotiate with their Serie A rivals.

ATLETI PLOT VILLARREAL RAID

Jose Mourinho plots defensive overhaul at Manchester United

Manchester United are looking to recruit an entire new defensive line as part of plans to overhaul their squad in the summer. Jose Mourinho believes the club’s progress on domestic and European fronts has been limited by the quality of its defenders and is considering upgrades. The addition of “decisive” individuals in each of these positions — Barcelona centre-back Samuel Umtiti and Juventus left-back Alex Sandro are among the players already approached — would allow Mourinho to deploy more aggressive tactics against stronger opposition.

BALOTELLI TO THE PL?

Mario Balotelli's agent Mino Raiola claims they are in talks with several clubs in England and Italy regarding a move for the striker.

Balotelli is out of contract at Nice in the summer having impressed in Ligue 1 since 2016.

“Mario is ready to return, he has matured into one of the top 10 strikers in the world," he said. “In Italy he’s number one. He’s worth €100m (£88m), but he’s on a free transfer and is therefore a bargain.

“I’m negotiating with many clubs in England and in Italy. I’ve spoken with Juventus, Roma, Napoli and Inter.”

費托宣佈季後離馬體會

【now.com體育】費蘭度托利斯在周一記者會上證實，在季後將會離開效力了15年的馬德里體育會。

費蘭度托利斯（Fernando Torres）跟馬德里體育會的合約在今季後就會完結，他表示：「當我10歲加盟這球會，一直都認為馬體會就是我的家。我享受在這裡的生涯，這是我夢寐以求的。可是，我要趁這個機會宣佈，今季將是我在這家球會的最後一季。」

34歲的費托在1995年加入馬體會青訓，於2007年加盟利物浦，之後效力過車路士、AC米蘭，到2016年回歸母會。他續說：「這不是一個容易下的決定，花了我很多時間及心力去決定。不過從現實的角度看，或許這是最佳的選擇。」

馬體會會長施里素盛讚王子是球會的傳奇：「這是費托的家，我只想感謝他為我們作出的貢獻。他將來退役後，馬體會的大門永遠為他打開。他值得最佳的歡送，我肯定球迷會參與這個特別的日子，而我們已努力為去準備，希望這天對馬體會大家庭及費托而言，都是難忘的。」

圖片來源 : ©AFP

INIESTA 'AGREES CHINA DEAL'

Andres Iniesta has agreed a deal with Tianjin Quanjian, reports Catalunya Radio.

There has been heavy speculation over the Spain playmaker’s future in recent weeks, with many suggesting he will end his lengthy association with Barcelona to move to China.

According to Catalunya Radio, the veteran midfielder has already sealed an agreement with Tianjin Quanjian for the next three seasons with the option for a further year. Iniesta will earn €37m a season before tax at the Chinese Super League club.

The player himself hinted that his time at Barcelona may be coming to an end on Tuesday night.

When asked if Barca’s 3-0 defeat at Roma was his last Champions League match for the club, he replied: "It’s a possibility, that’s why it’s tough to take. But it's tough to take for everyone. There is lots of excitement for this competition and we have failed again."

Exclusive: Manchester United name Martial price-tag amid Juventus links


Manchester United will only sanction Anthony Martial’s transfer in the upcoming window if they receive a fee of anything above €50 million (£43.2 million).

The France international, who joined the Red Devils from AS Monaco in 2015, will have one year left on his contract after the end of this season. Jose Mourinho’s side have offered him a new deal, but the forward has already turned down the opportunity to sign an extension.

Calciomercato.com reports Martial’s agent has already discussed the possibility of offering his clients to the top clubs in Europe. Juventus is one of those clubs interested in signing the 22-year-old who has reat potential.

In addition to this, Bayern Munich are also looking at the option of signing Martial in the summer transfer window. However, the price tag could be a factor as the €50 million asking price is the minimum fee required to persuade United to let their player leave.

http://www.calciomercato.com/en/news/exclusive-manchester-united-name-martial-price-tag-amid-juventus-57020

PL TRIO KEEN ON KURZAWA

RMC say three of the Premier League’s top sides are interested in PSG’s Layvin Kurzawa, who looks set to leave the club this summer.

Chelsea apparently made a move for the player in January and lead the race, while Tottenham and Manchester United are also said to be interested.

PSG WANT CASEMIRO

PSG are willing to go all out to sign Real Madrid star Casemiro this summer, reports AS.

Manchester United sounded out his situation a few months ago and now PSG are keen on the Brazilian.

The French capital club see him as a long-term replacement for Thiago Motta and are willing to make a huge offer to secure his services.

The 26-year-old is under contract at the Bernabeu until 2021 with a €200m buyout clause.

'SPURS PLAN GRAY MOVE'

ESPN are reporting that Tottenham are considering a move for Leicester's Demarai Gray in the summer.

Apparently Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino has continued to keep an eye on Gray, having expressed an interest last year when Leicester refused to consider offers.

Mario Balotelli posts enigmatic message amidst Juve and Roma links

Former AC Milan and Inter Milan star Mario Balotelli has posted a cryptic message on Instagram, amidst rumors linking him with moves to a host of Serie A clubs recently.

The 27-year-old Italian Balotelli has found his lost form since he joined Nice in the summer of 2016. This season too, he's been vital to the club's goals. He has appeared 23 times in the Serie A this season, scoring as many as 14 times and the striker has also scored six times in the club's Europa League campaign.

Recently, Balotelli posted a rather enigmatic message on Instagram, strangely thanking everyone for their support to him during his two-year long stay at Nice.

The message read: It’s being 2 amazing years thanks to everyone... still 5 games to go #issanissa
( is not a bye for now.. you never know the future
Kaustubh Pandey(@Kaus_Pandey17)

KEITA ON THE CHEAP?

Sky Sports News understands Naby Keita's value could be falling ahead of his summer Liverpool move, with the RB Leipzig midfielder's price dropping from £59m if if the German club finish in the Champions League places.

It will drop to £52.75m if they qualify for the Europa League, and further to £48m if they finish seventh or below.

Leipzig fell to sixth due to a 5-2 home defeat to Hoffenheim last weekend - a game where Keita scored.

replies.msg:
@Sammy_Goal

The plans for the forwards are complicated. As I said last week they’ve narrowed down their options (they now have a list of just two). But they’re not as advanced with those two as they are with Jorginho, so they are in a position to be flexible if Mbappe becomes available

Should clarify that City have a (very) shortlist of two forwards, but they only want to sign one forward player this summer (barring unexpected outgoings). Right now they only plan to sign two players in total, and want both by middle of June. Maybe July for the forward

I dunno who the 2 concrete names on the forward list are, I hadn’t planned to write this until I found out, but there we go! This is what I know now: Mahrez interest isn’t dead, so he’s possible. As for Hazard/Bailey I’d be guessing right now. If they can get Mbappe they will

GAZIDIS FAVOURS ARTETA FOR ARSENAL POST

Arsenal’s chief executive Ivan Gazidis - the man who will ultimately recommend a new head coach to owner Stan Kroenke - believes Mikel Arteta could be the man to replace Arsene Wenger, Sky Sports News understands.

quote.msg:

replies.msg:
GUNNERS KINGMAKERS DIVIDED

Gazidis, along with Head of Football Operations, Raul Sanllehi and head of recruitment Sven Mislintat, will this week begin discussions with potential candidates.

Sky Sports News understands Sanllehi, the former director of football at Barcelona, favours his former colleague Luis Enrique as the man to take the reins over from Wenger.

Arsenal’s third kingmaker, Mislintat – who joined Arsenal from Borussia Dortmund in November, is reportedly keen on Hoffenheim manager Julian Nagelsmann and Schalke’s Domenico Tedesco.

Thomas Tuchel, who last month was the bookies’ favourite to replace Wenger, now looks set to join PSG as Unai Emery’s replacement.

At this early stage, both Brendan Rodgers and Rafa Benitez are not thought to be strong candidates.

replies.msg:
NO ITALY TALKS FOR ANCELOTTI

Alessandro Costacurta, the sub-commissioner of the Italian FA, has played down his meeting with Carlo Ancelotti last night in Rome.

"Carlo was in Rome for personal reasons," he told Sky Sports in Italy. "I always stay in that hotel and we found each other there. We did not talk about the job, we only joked about the opportunity. You have to talk about many things, the program and finances, but we could not talk about them.

"Since we are loyal to the rules, we talked about something else. It is true, there is a vision that could see Carlo, like others, on the bench of the national team, but the rules are important and we must follow them. The deadline is May 20 and you know I wouldn’t go against the rules. Unfortunately we spoke about something else."

Will there be an official meeting?

"Yes, but I still do not know when. We need people who are available, we cannot get close to contracted coaches. This is the problem."

BREAKING NEWS

Manchester City have rubbished reports that John Stones could be allowed to leave this summer.

The England defender hasn’t played for the club since returning from international duty because of an abductor injury.

That's led to speculation that he’s no longer part of Pep Guardiola’s long-term plans.

However, we have been told that Stones will not be going anywhere, and will be part of the squad aiming to defend the Premier League title next season.
